obsidian.utils¶

Modules¶

obsidian.utils.build_bg_files¶

Create background file from images classified as blank

obsidian.utils.build_bg_files.bg_from_blanks(top, dest)¶

Make background file by averaging images classified as blanks (without rings)

Parameters:
  • top (str) – top level directory containing image folders
  • dest (str) – destination for background file
obsidian.utils.build_bg_files.bg_from_scan(top, dest, folders)¶

Seek out background scan directories and build background files

Parameters:
  • top (str) – top level directory containing image folders
  • dest (str) – destination for background file
  • folders (collection) – list or tuple of folder strings to demarcate background scans (e.g. (‘g1’, ‘f1’) )

obsidian.utils.data_handling¶

General data handling for loading and analysis

obsidian.utils.data_handling.join_files(end_path, paths)¶

Combine multiple pickled dictionaries into a single pickle file

Parameters:
  • end_path (str) – path of target combined file
  • paths (list) – list of paths of pickle files to be combined
obsidian.utils.data_handling.make_frame(datadict, classified=False)¶

Create dataframe out of paths contained in datadict

Parameters:
  • datadict (dict) – dict in with entries Type:pathlist with Type e.g ‘Class’, ‘Data’
  • classified (bool) – if True, construct frame with Class column
obsidian.utils.data_handling.new_database(data_dir, classes_dir, save_path='')¶
obsidian.utils.data_handling.pickle_get(path)¶

Wrapper function for fetching pickled file contents

Parameters:path (str) – path of pickle file
Returns:contents of pickle file
obsidian.utils.data_handling.pickle_put(path, data)¶

Wrapper function for dumping data to pickle file

Parameters:
  • path (str) – destination path
  • data – object to be pickled
obsidian.utils.data_handling.read_header(f, params)¶

Extract desired parameters from header file. Will not work correctly if params contain any spaces

Parameters:
  • f (str) – header file path
  • params (list) – List of strings, each the name of a parameter found in the header
Returns:

dict of param:values where values is a list of all subsequent space separated strings

Example:

read_header(<header/file/path>, ['Beam_xy', 'Detector_distance'])

returns:

{'Beam_xy' : ['(1251.51,', '1320.12)', 'pixels'], 'Detector_distance':['0.49906','m']}
obsidian.utils.data_handling.split_data(data_list, chunk_size)¶

Handle reading and processing data in chunks to avoid the process being killed

Parameters:
  • data_list (list) – list of items to be split into chunks
  • chunk_size (int) – number of items per chunk
Returns:

list of sublists of size chunk_size (except the final sublist, which contains remainder)
obsidian.utils.data_handling.update_database(old_database, new_data, save=False)¶

Add new data to existing database

Parameters:
  • old_database (str) – path to existing database
  • new_data (list) – paths to new data files

obsidian.utils.imgdisp¶

Tool for displaying a set of images side by side

class obsidian.utils.imgdisp.ImgDisp(collection, bgimage=None)¶

Bases: object

Display a collection of images in a compact arrangement

Parameters:
  • collection – collection of images to be displayed
  • bgimage – background image to be displayed alongside
disp()¶

Display image collection together with background image if specified

Returns:fig, axes
